entries.femaleVariant: Good day. I'm Arif Iqbal and you're watching WNS News.
Our coverage today centers on NUSA President Rosalind Myers.
President Myers has officially announced her bid for another term in the upcoming election.
Political analysts have argued that the risk for large-scale conflict in North America stands to increase further under Myers's continued leadership.
Myers's cornerstone policy is her so-called "unification" plan, which many claim will severely limit civic freedoms and our inalienable right to self-determination.
President Myers also hasn't shied away from her ties to Militech where she led as CEO for nearly a decade.

The interventionist and protectionist stance she adopted while there may prove a stable bedrock for economic growth in the NUSA, true – but risk considerable damage to the rest of America and Night City.
Myers has also established herself as a staunch opponent of Arasaka Corp. She has repeatedly refused to sign truce agreements proposed by CEO Saburo Arasaka.
What's more, her role in the so-called Busan Holocaust remains shrouded in mystery – a senseless tragedy that extinguished millions of lives.
Despite numerous appeals, Militech has refused to disclose documents related to the merciless attack.
The consensus among experts confirms that Myers's reelection would spell disaster not only for the NUSA, but for all of North America.
If you'd like to sign a petition in opposition to her candidacy, please visit the address below.
In the quest for truth, we're WNS News. Tune in next time!
